alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:06AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. .High flows are expected on the Wild Rice River from ongoing rainfall. Combined with backwater from the Red River, the Wild Rice River at Hendrum is anticipated to cross into moderate flood levels. This forecast takes into account past precipitation and rainfall forecasts through 7 AM Sunday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 31.0 feet, Water levels reach low steel on bottom of Co. Hwy 25 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Saturday was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 31.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
